get.summary: Request that handles the form authentication cookie from SBL

parameters.description: The url to redirect to if everything validates ok

get.summary: Action for exchanging a JWT generated by a trusted token provider with a new JWT for further use as authentication against rest of Altinn.

get.summary:
Retrieves the Status (Response model) for a Request
based only on the Request.Id GUID

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: The UUID for the Request

delete.summary: Used by the Vendors to delete the chosen Request by guid

get.summary:
Retrieves the Status (Response model) for a Request
based on the SystemId, OrgNo and the ExternalRef 
( which is enforced as a unique combination )

parameters.name: systemId
parameters.description: The Id for the chosen Registered System.

parameters.name: externalRef
parameters.description: The chosen external ref the Vendor sent in to the Create Request

parameters.name: orgNo
parameters.description: The organisation number for the customer

get.summary: Used by the BFF to authenticate the PartyId to retrieve the chosen Request by guid

parameters.name: party
parameters.description: the partyId

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: The UUID of the request to be approved

parameters.description: The Id of the Product

parameters.name: systemId
parameters.description: The human readable string id

get.summary: Returns the list of SystemUsers this PartyID has registered

post.summary:
Creates a new SystemUser
The unique Id for the systemuser is handled by the db.
But the calling client may send a guid for the request of creating a new system user
to ensure that there is no mismatch if the same partyId creates several new SystemUsers at the same time

get.summary: Return a single SystemUser by PartyId and SystemUserId

delete.summary: Set the Delete flag on the identified SystemUser

get.summary: Used by MaskinPorten, to find if a given systemOrg owns a SystemUser Integration for a Vendor's Product, by an ExternalId

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The unique id maintained by MaskinPorten tying their clients to the Registered Systems the ServiceProivders have created in our db.

parameters.name: systemProviderOrgNo
parameters.description: The legal number (Orgno) of the Vendor creating the Registered System (Accounting system)

parameters.name: systemUserOwnerOrgNo
parameters.description: The legal number (Orgno) of the party owning the System User Integration

put.summary: Replaces the values for the existing system user with those from the update

get.summary: Retrieves a list of SystemUsers the Vendor has for a given system they own.

parameters.description: The system the Vendor wants the list for

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Optional continuation token

jwks_uri.description: URL of the JSON Web Key Set document.

authorization_endpoint.description: URL of the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Endpoint.

token_endpoint.description: URL of the OAuth 2.0 Token Endpoint.

end_session_endpoint.description: URL of the end session Endpoint.

check_session_iframe.description: URL for the session check Endpoint.

frontchannel_logout_supported.description: Value indicating whether there is a front channel mechanism for logout.

frontchannel_logout_session_supported.description: Value indicating wheter there is a front channel mechanism for session logout.

token_endpoint_auth_methods_supported.description: Array of supported authentication methods on the token endpoint.

code_challenge_methods_supported.description: Array of supported code challenge methods.

DiscoveryDocument.description:
Represents the well known discovery document described by "OpenID Connect Discovery 1.0 incorporating errata set 1"
URL: https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-discovery-1_0.html (and other specifications)

GuidOpaque.description:
An opaque value is a value that can be transmitted to another party
                without divulging any type information or expectations about the value.
            


                Opaque values are typically usefull in APIs where the server wants to
                be able to return a value that the client later needs to send back to
                the server, but where the server does not want to expose the type of
                the value to the client. For instance, in a pagination scenario, the
                server can use an opaque int to do pagination by page number, while
                allowing itself to later change the implementation to use a cursor
                instead of a page number without breaking the API.

active.description: Gets or sects the active property indicating if the request token was valid

iss.description: Gets or sets the issuer of the validated request token.

kty.description: Gets or sets the type of key this is. E.g. RSA

use.description: Gets or sets the type of use. E.g. sig

kid.description: Gets or sets a unique id for the key.

e.description: Gets or sets the RSA exponent value of the key.

n.description: Gets or sets the RSA modulus value of the key.

x5c.description: Gets or sets a list of base64 encoded certificate where each new item is the parent certificate of the previous in a certificate chain.

JwkDocument.description:
Represents a Json Wen Key as described by "JSON Web Key (JWK) draft-ietf-jose-json-web-key-41"
URL: https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-jose-json-web-key-41

keys.description: Gets or sets the list of keys in the key set.

JwksDocument.description:
Represents a Json Wen Key set as described by "JSON Web Key (JWK) draft-ietf-jose-json-web-key-41"
URL: https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-jose-json-web-key-41

next.description: Link to the next page of items (if any).

StringOpaque.description:
An opaque value is a value that can be transmitted to another party
                without divulging any type information or expectations about the value.
            


                Opaque values are typically usefull in APIs where the server wants to
                be able to return a value that the client later needs to send back to
                the server, but where the server does not want to expose the type of
                the value to the client. For instance, in a pagination scenario, the
                server can use an opaque int to do pagination by page number, while
                allowing itself to later change the implementation to use a cursor
                instead of a page number without breaking the API.
